Transcription for 580481

The beds, as I say, were not very comfortable, I would imagine.
I don't know whether they were actually straw filled, probably horsehair filled,
but as I say, not very comfortable.
The sheets and bed linen were a delicate shade of grey.
Why on earth this was? Every other hospital I've worked in, the sheets were spotlessly white,
but in Hensel, something to do with the laundry, I don't know, but I was appalled
at these horrible grey sheets that we have to use.
The bed linen, of course, were no duvets in those days, it had to be blankets.
And these, again, were washed as frequently as they required, is the only way I can put it.
